USING DATA WITH A WORKING DATE OF 09/17/2002 FOR PAGO PAGO, AMERICAN SAMOA, TIDE STATION 177 0000 BASED ON THE FOLLOWING--  LENGTH OF SERIES                = 19 YEARS TIME PERIOD                     = JANUARY 1983 - DECEMBER 2001 TIDAL EPOCH                     = 1983-2001  BENCH MARK ELEVATION INFORMATION        IN METERS ABOVE  STAMPING OR DESIGNATION            MLLW        MHW  0000 S 1993                        1.765     0.982  USING ELEVATIONS OF MEAN HIGH WATER (MHW) AND MEAN SEA LEVEL (MSL) TIDAL DATUMS REFERRED TO MEAN LOWER LOW WATER (MLLW), IN METERS -  (MHW - MSL) = 0.783 - 0.401 = 0.382 METER  (MHW - MSL) + MHW FOR 0000 S 1993 = 0.382 + 0.982 = 1.364 METERS   THE ORTHOMETRIC HEIGHTS RESULTING FROM THE ASVD02 ADJUSTMENT WHICH IS PLANNED TO BE DONE IN THE SPRING OF 2003 WILL BE COMPUTED BASED ON NORMAL GRAVITY (SEE USC+GS SPECIAL PUBLICATION 240).  NOTE--'TRUE' ORTHOMETRIC HEIGHTS WILL BE RECOMPUTED LATER WHEN ACTUAL GRAVITY VALUES ARE AVAILABLE IN AMERICAN SAMOA. markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.description: DESCRIBED BY AMERICAN SAMOA SURVEY 1968 (CND) THE STATION IS ON TUTUILA ISLAND.  IT IS AT THE NORTHWEST END OF AASU VILLAGE ON THE NORTH BANK OF AASU STREAM.  THE STATION CAN BEST BE REACHED BY TAKING A BOAT FROM PAGO PAGO OR FAGATELE TO AASU VILLAGE. THERE IS ALSO A GOOD TRAIL LEADING FROM FAGATELE TO AASU VILLAGE WHICH WOULD TAKE ABOUT 2-1/2 HOURS TO PACK.  THE STATION MARK IS AN AMERICAN SAMOA TRIANGULATION STATION DISK STAMPED---AASU 1968---.  IT IS SET IN THE TOP OF A CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 5 INCHES.  IT IS 50 FEET WEST OF THE SHORE LINE, 19 FEET NORTH OF AASU STREAM AND 8 FEET EAST OF A PALM TREE WITH A WITNESS SIGN.  IT IS UNDER A LARGE SHADE TREE IN FRONT OF THE NORTHERN MOST FALE IN THE VILLAGE.  RM 1 IS AN AMERICAN SAMOA REFERENCE MARK DISK STAMPED---AASU RM 1 1968---.  IT IS SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN A BOULDER UNDER THE SHADE TREE IN THE FILLED AREA OF THE YARD. IT IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 6-INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 7 INCHES.  IT IS 31 FEET WEST OF THE TRAIL, 22 FEET SOUTH OF AASU STREAM AND 12 FEET WEST OF A PALM TREE. markers.description: DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1968 (CND) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 3-1/2 MILES EAST-NORTHEAST OF PAGO PAGO, IN AFONO VILLAGE AND JUST NORTH OF A SCHOOL BUILDING, ON THE TOP OF AN OLD WW-II PILLBOX, THAT PROJECTS ABOUT 3 FEET ABOVE THE SHORELINE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN FAGATOGO, FOLLOW THE HIGHWAY AROUND NORTH SIDE OF HARBOR FOR 4.0 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT, IN AUA VILLAGE. FOLLOW GOOD TRAIL UP, OVER PASS AND DOWN TO AFONO VILLAGE AND STATION AT THE SCHOOL BUILDINGS, ABOUT A 1-1/2 PACK.  THE STATION MAY ALSO BE REACHED BY TAKING A MOTOR LAUNCH FROM PAGO PAGO HARBOR TO AFONO BAY.  THE STATION MARK, STAMPED---AFONO 1968---, IS A GOVERNMENT OF AMERICAN SAMOA DISK, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN TOP OF THE CONCRETE PILL BOX.  IT IS 23.0 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTER POST BETWEEN TWO RED DOORS OF A SCHOOL BUILDING.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1, STAMPED---AFONO RM 1 1968---, IS A GOVERNMENT OF AMERICAN SAMOA DISK, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF THE CONCRETE PORCH OF THE SCHOOL BUILDING. REFERENCE MARK NO. 2, STAMPED---AFONO RM 2 1968---, IS A GOVERNMENT OF AMERICAN SAMOA DISK, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE CONCRETE PORCH OF THE SCHOOL BUILDING. markers.setting: SET IN ROCK OUTCROP
markers.description: DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1968 (CND) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 2 MILES EAST OF ILIILI, 1 MILE NORTHEAST OF VAITOGI, ON THE COAST LINE AND ON THE SOUTH TIP OF A NARROW STRIP OF ROCK THAT HAS ABOUT A 30 FOOT BLUFF ON ITS SOUTH, EAST AND WEST SIDES.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE TERMINAL BUILDING AT THE PAGO PAGO INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT, GO SOUTHWEST FOR 0.2 MILE TO A Y-FORK. THIS IS ABOUT 200 YARDS WEST OF THE U.S. WEATHER BUREAU INSTALLATION. TAKE THE LEFT FORK AND SOUTHWEST FOR 1.5 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT. TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHERLY FOR 0.6 MILE TO A DIM SIDE ROAD RIGHT, ABOUT 50 FEET NORTH OF A HOUSE.  -A 4-WHEEL DRIVE VEHICLE IS REQUIRED FROM THIS POINT.-  TURN RIGHT AND GO WEST AND SOUTHWEST ON THE DIM TRACK ROAD FOR 0.35 MILE TO THE END OF THE ROAD AT AN ABANDONED ROCK HOUSE AND THE END OF TRUCK TRAVEL.  PACK EAST FOR ABOUT 100 YARDS TO THE SHORELINE, THENCE BEAR LEFT AND FOLLOW THE SHORELINE NORTH AND EAST FOR ABOUT 200 YARDS TO THE STATION.  A 5 MINUTE PACK.  THE STATION MARK, STAMPED---ALATELE 1968---, IS A GOVERNMENT OF AMERICAN SAMOA DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN BEDROCK.  IT IS 9 FEET NORTH OF THE SOUTH EDGE OF THE POINT OF LAND, 8 FEET EAST OF THE WEST EDGE AND 6 FEET WEST OF THE EAST EDGE. TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE PAGO PAGO POST OFFICE, GO SOUTH AND SOUTHEAST ON THE SURFACED ROAD FOR 2.2 MILES TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT.  THIS IS JUST BEFORE REACHING A CONCRETE BRIDGE.  THE STATION MARK, STAMPED---FAGAALU 1968---, IS A GOVERNMENT OF AMERICAN SAMOA DISK SET IN THE TOP OF AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE THAT IS ABOUT 1 FOOT IN DIAMETER AND FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  IT IS 39 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE CONCRETE BRIDGE, 35 FEET WEST OF THE CENTER OF THE ROAD, 16 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTER OF A DRIVEWAY AND 15 FEET EAST OF POWER POLE NUMBER 134.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1, STAMPED---FAGAALU RM 1 1968---, IS A GOVERNMENT OF AMERICAN SAMOA DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN AN OLD PIECE OF CONCRETE THAT IS ABOUT 3 FEET IN DIAMETER AND PROJECTS 4 INCHES.  IT IS 44 FEET WEST-NORTHWEST OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE BRIDGE, 53 FEET WEST OF THE CENTER OF THE ROAD, 38 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTER OF THE DRIVEWAY AND 12 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE POWER POLE.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2, STAMPED---US NAVY PBM NO 5 1943 ELEV 105.926 GBMU 506---, IS A BRASS DISK WITH A RAISED PLUG IN THE CENTER AND IT IS CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE WEST ABUTMENT OF THE CONCRETE BRIDGE.  IT IS 13 FEET WEST OF THE CENTER OF THE ROAD AND 7 FEET NORTH OF THE SOUTH END OF THE BRIDGE.  TRIANGULATION STATION SOSOPO MAY BE USED FOR AN AZIMUTH MARK. -SEE DESCRIPTION THEREOF.-                            STATION RECOVERY (2002)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 2002 (FW) THE MARK WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE STATION IS LOCATED IN THE VILLAGE OF FAGAALU ON THE ISLAND OF TUTUILA IN AMERICAN SAMOA. NOTE--AS 33 2002 WAS STAMPED IN DISK FOR 2002 PROJECT.                            STATION RECOVERY (UNK )  RECOVERED UNK RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.

markers.setting: SET IN A PAVEMENT SUCH AS STREET, SIDEWALK, CURB, ETC.
markers.description: DESCRIBED BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1968 (RNG) STATION IS LOCATED AT THE NW EDGE OF FAGATELE VILLAGE, AT THE LEAATELE CONSOLIDATED SCHOOL GROUNDS.  TO REACH FROM THE POST OFFICE IN FAGATOGO, GO WESTERLY ON PAVED ROAD TOWARD PAGO PAGO FOR 1.2 MILES (1.9 KM) TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT.  TURN LEFT ON GRADED ROAD AND GO SOUTHWESTERLY FOR 1.4 MILES (2.3 KM) TO TOP OF PASS.  HERE CONTINUE DOWN HILL FOR 0.9 MILE (1.4 KM) TO A T INTERSECTION AND THE AZIMUTH MARK NEAR A STEEL GUARD RAIL AT EDGE OF BEACH.  HERE TURN LEFT AND GO WNW ON GRADED ROAD AROUND EDGE OF BEACH TO THE LEAATELE CONSOLIDATED SCHOOL AND STATION AS DESCRIBED.  STATION IS A STANDARD AMERICAN SAMOAN TRIANGULATION STATION DISK, SET FLUSH IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE SW CORNER OF A 4X4 FOOT CONCRETE PAD WHICH SUPPORTS A FLAGPOLE.  IT IS 24 FT (7.3 M) E OF THE MOST NORTHERLY POINT OF THE MOST NORTHERLY SCHOOL BUILDING, 2 FT (0.6 M) SW OF THE FLAGPOLE.  THE DISK IS STAMPED FAGATELE 1968.  RM NO 1 IS A STANDARD AMERICAN SAMOAN RM DISK, SET IN THE TOP OF A 6 INCH DIAMETER CONCRETE POST, WHICH IS SURROUNDED BY A 2 FOOT (0.6 M) MASS OF CONCRETE AND PROJECTS 4 INCHES.  IT IS 63 FT (19.2 M) N OF A FLAGPOLE, 7 FT (2.1 M) SE OF A SMALL DITCH, 6 FT (1.8 M) NW OF A ROCK PATH.  THE DISK IS STAMPED FAGATELE R M 1 1968.  RM NO 2 IS A STANDARD AMERICAN SAMOAN REFERENCE MARK DISK, SET FLUSH IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE CONCRETE SIDEWALK WHICH SURROUNDS THE MOST NORTHERLY BUILDING OF THE SCHOOL.  IT IS 26 FT (7.9 M) W OF THE FLAGPOLE, 6 INCHES N OF THE N EDGE OF THE BUILDING. THE DISK IS STMPED FAGATELE R M 2 1968.  AZ MK IS A STANDARD SAMOAN AZ MK DISK, SET IN THE TOP OF A 6 INCH DIAMETER CONCRETE POST, WHICH IS SURROUNDED BY A 2 FOOT (0.6 M) MASS OF CONCRETE AND IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  IT IS 16 FT (4.9 M) S OF THE N END OF THE GUARD RAIL, 7 FT (2.1 M) SE OF A POWER POLE, 4 FT (1.2 M) N OF THE S END OF THE GUARD RAIL.  THE DISK IS STAMPED FAGATELE AZIMUTH 1968.                            STATION RECOVERY (UNK )  RECOVERED UNK RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.

markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.description: DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1968 (CND) THE STATION IS LOCATED ON A LOW HILL JUST SOUTHEAST OF THE AERIAL TRAMWAY LANDING, ABOUT 1-1/2 AIRLINE MILES EAST-SOUTHEAST OF PAGO PAGO AND ABOUT 1/4 AIRLINE MILE SOUTHWEST OF THE INTERNATIONAL HOTEL.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN FAGATOGO, GO EASTERLY ON THE MAIN ROAD FOR 0.5 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT AT LEE AUDITORIUM. TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTH AND WEST ON A WINDING PAVED ROAD FOR 0.5 MILE TO THE AERIAL TRAMWAY LANDING ON THE RIGHT AND END OF TRUCK TRAVEL. FROM HERE PACK EAST UPHILL ON A WELL MARKED TRAIL FOR ABOUT 50 YARDS TO A SMALL ROUND BUILDING AND THE STATION JUST EAST OF THE BUILDING.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD AMERICAN SAMOA TRIANGULATION STATION DISK STAMPED---FAGATOGO 1968---, SET IN THE TOP OF A ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 1-INCH.  IT IS 9 FEET WEST OF THE EAST EDGE OF A CLIFF, 6 FEET NORTH OF THE SOUTH EDGE OF THE CLIFF AND 4 FEET EAST OF THE SMALL ROUND BUILDING.  REFERENCE MARK NO 1 IS A STANDARD AMERICAN SAMOA REFERENCE MARK DISK STAMPED---FAGATOGO RM 1 1968---, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE SOUTHEAST FOUNDATION OF THE SMALL ROUND BUILDING AND IT PROJECTS 18-INCHES.  IT IS 5 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE SOUTHEAST EDGE OF THE CLIFF AND 0.5 FOOT NORTHWEST OF THE SOUTHEAST EDGE OF THE SMALL ROUND BUILDING.  REFERENCE MARK NO 2 IS A STANDARD AMERICAN SAMOA REFERENCE MARK DISK STAMPED---FAGATOGO RM 2 1968---, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE NORTHEAST FOUNDATION OF THE SMALL ROUND BUILDING AND IT PROJECTS 18-INCHES.  IT IS 5 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE NORTHEAST EDGE OF THE CLIFF AND 0.5 FOOT SOUTHWEST OF THE NORTHEAST EDGE OF THE SMALL ROUND BUILDING.  TRIANGULATION STATION PULE MAY BE USED FOR AN AZIMUTH MARK.  -SEE DESCRIPTION THEREOF-.                            STATION RECOVERY (UNK )  RECOVERED UNK RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1968 (CND) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN FAGATOGO AND AT THE GOVERNORS MANSION.  THE FLAGPOLE IS WHITE IN COLOR, ABOUT 10 FEET IN LENGTH AND SETS ATOP AND ON THE EAST END OF THE ROOF OF THE MANSION.  POINT INTERSECTED IS THE TOP AND CENTER OF THE FLAGPOLE.                            STATION RECOVERY (UNK )  RECOVERED UNK RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1968 (CND) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN FAGATOGO, ATOP AND NEAR THE NORTHEAST END OF TOGOTOGO RIDGE.  TO REACH FROM THE PAGO PAGO POST OFFICE, GO EAST AND SOUTH FOR 0.5 MILE TO A SIDE STREET RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO WEST AND SOUTH FOR 0.3 MILE TO A Y-FORK.  TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND GO WEST AND NORTH FOR 0.2 MILE TO TOP OF RIDGE AND THE STATION.  THE TANK IS A CYLINDRICAL, STEEL STRUCTURE, GREEN IN COLOR AND IS ABOUT 35 FEET HIGH.  POINT INTERSECTED IS THE VENT ATOP AND CENTER OF THE TANK.                            STATION RECOVERY (UNK )  RECOVERED UNK RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.

markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.description: DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1968 (CND) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 2-3/4 AIRLINE MILES EAST-NORTHEAST OF LEONE VILLAGE, ABOUT 1/2 AIRLINE MILE SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF MAPUSAGA SCHOOL AND IN THE VILLAGE OF FALENIU.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE DISPENSARY IN LEONE VILLAGE, GO EAST AND NORTH ON THE MAIN ROAD FOR 4.2 MILES TO THE FALENIU L.M.S. CHURCH ON THE RIGHT AND THE STATION. THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD AMERICAN SAMOA TRIANGULATION DISK STAMPED---FALENIU 1968---, SET IN THE TOP OF A 6-INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE.  IT IS 35 FEET WEST OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE CHURCH AND 15 FEET EAST OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE HIGHWAY.  REFERENCE MARK NO 1 IS A STANDARD AMERICAN SAMOA REFERENCE DISK STAMPED---FALENIU RM 1 1968---, SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE BOTTOM STEP OF A WALKWAY ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE HIGHWAY.  IT IS 71 FEET WEST OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE CHURCH AND 22 FEET WEST OF THE CENTER OF THE HIGHWAY.  REFERENCE MARK NO 2 IS AN IRON PEG DROVE IN THE EAST PART OF THE HIGHWAY.  IT HAS NO STAMPING AND IT IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE. IT IS 103 FEET SOUTH OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE CHURCH AND 3 FEET EAST OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE HIGHWAY. TRIANGULATION STATION OLOTELE 2 ET -USGS- 1962 MAY BE USED AS AN AZIMUTH MARK.  SEE DESCRIPTION THEREOF.                            STATION RECOVERY (UNK )  RECOVERED UNK RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.

THE STATION IS SET INTO DRILL HOLE IN CONCRETE STEPS, 8.40 FEET (2.56 M) SOUTHWEST OF L P FRENCH MARK ON SIDEWALK, 35.31 FEET (10.76 M) SOUTHEAST OF A FIRE HYDRANT, 35.39 FEET (10.79 M) WEST FROM A WATER VALVE, 31.36 FEET (9.56 M) NORTHWEST OF A WATER VALVE ON THE SIDEWALK, 24.67 FEET (7.52 M) EAST OF A POWER POLE NO 46BA32. TO REACH FROM THE GOVERNMENT DISPENSARY IN LEONE, GO EASTERLY ON PAVED ROAD FOR 0.6 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  -JUST AFTER CROSSING A SMALL CONCRETE BRIDGE.-  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHWEST AND SOUTHEAST ON PAVED ROAD FOR 0.85 MILE TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT AS DESCRIBED.  STATION IS A STANDARD AMERICAN SAMOA TRIANGULATION DISK, SET IN THE TOP OF A 6-INCH DIAMETER CONCRETE POST, WHICH IS 4-INCHES BELOW GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 130 FEET NORTHWEST OF A POWER POLE NO. 15, 19 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE ROAD.  THE DISK IS STAMPED---FALILI 1968---.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS A STANDARD AMERICAN SAMOA REFERENCE MARK DISK, CEMENTED FLUSH IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE CONCRETE SIDEWALK OF THE SCHOOL.  IT IS 138 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE ROAD, 63 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE MOST SOUTHEAST BUILDING OF THE SCHOOL.  THE DISK IS STAMPED---FALILI RM 1 1968---.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS A STANDARD AMERICAN SAMOA REFERENCE MARK DISK, SET IN THE TOP OF A 6-INCH DIAMETER CONCRETE POST, WHICH PROJECTS 3 INCHES.  IT IS 175 FEET NORTHWEST OF A POWER POLE NO. 15, 20 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE ROAD.  THE DISK IS STAMPED---FALILI RM 2 1968---.  THERE WAS NO AZIMUTH MARK SET TO THIS STATION. markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.description: DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1968 (CND) THE STATION IS ON TUTUILA ISLAND, 2.0 MILES EAST-NORTHEAST OF AASU VILLAGE AND 0.7 MILE WEST OF THE VILLAGE OF FAGATELE.  IT IS ON THE HIGH GROUND AT THE NORTH END OF FATUELO POINT.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE NORTHWEST END OF THE VILLAGE OF FAGATELE, TAKE THE TRAIL LEADING TO AASU VILLAGE FOR ABOUT 0.5 MILE TO A CONCRETE PAD ON THE LEFT, CONTINUE AHEAD FOR 100 FEET TO A DIM TRAIL ON THE RIGHT.  TAKE THE RIGHT FORK DOWN HILL FOR ABOUT 0.2 MILE TO THE STATION ON THE HIGH GROUND AT THE NORTH END OF THE POINT.  THE STATION MARK IS AN AMERICAN SAMOA TRIANGULATION STATION DISK, STAMPED---FATUELO 1968---.  IT IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 6-INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 2 INCHES. IT IS 5 FEET EAST OF A STEEP BLUFF, 6 FEET WEST OF A 10-INCH TREE WITH A TRIANGLE BLAZE AND 10 FEET WEST OF A STEEP BLUFF.  IT IS ABOUT 150 FEET ABOVE THE OCEAN.  RM 1 IS AN AMERICAN SAMOA REFERENCE MARK DISK STAMPED---FATUELO RM 1 1968---.  IT IS SET IN THE TOP OF A LENGTH OF 2-INCH PIPE WHICH PROJECTS 10 INCHES.  IT IS IN THE CENTER OF THE NARROW RIDGE ABOUT THE SAME ELEVATION AS THE STATION.  IT IS 23 FEET SOUTH OF THE TREE WITH A TRIANGLE BLAZE.  THERE IS NO SUITABLE BOAT LANDING IN THE VICINITY OF THE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (UNK )  RECOVERED UNK RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.

markers.setting: SET IN ROCK OUTCROP
markers.description: DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1968 (CND) THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE NORTH SHORE OF OFU ISLAND ABOUT 1/2 AIRLINE MILE NORTH OF OFU VILLAGE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE LMS CHURCH IN OFU VILLAGE, PACK NORTH ON A TRAIL FOR 10 MINUTES TO THE NORTH EDGE OF OFU VILLAGE.  CONTINUE NORTHERLY ALONG THE SHORE LINE FOR ABOUT 25 MINUTES TO THE STATION IN A LARGE OUTCROPP OF BEDROCK ON THE NORTH TIP OF OFU ISLAND.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD AMERICAN SAMOA STATION DISK STAMPED---FEIA 1968---, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE OUTCROPPING BEDROCK WHICH PROJECTS 30 FEET ABOVE THE WATER.  IT IS 6 FEET SOUTH OF A CLIFF.  PIUMAFUA AZIMUTH ET -USGS- 1962 IS A U.S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY REFERENCE DISK STAMPED---PIUMAFUA AZIMUTH ET 1962 R N GARDNER---, SET IN A MASS OF CONCRETE IN A DEPRESSION IN A OUTCROPP OF BEDROCK WHICH PROJECTS 20 FEET ABOVE THE WATER.  IT IS 12 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE NORTHEAST EDGE OF THE BEDROCK.  TRAVERSE STATION NUUTELE MAY BE USED AS AN AZIMUTH MARK.  SEE DESCRIPTION THEREOF.                            STATION RECOVERY (UNK )  RECOVERED UNK RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1962 (RNG) LOCATED ON FITIUTA POINT N OF VILLAGE OF MAIA. ABOUT 1500 FT NW OF SCHOOL IN FITIUTA. STATION IS NEXT TO SOUTHERNMOST BLACK ROCK OF POINT NEAR OCEAN EDGE AND ABOUT 100 FT FROM EDGE OF BUSH.   STATION MARK IS A STANDARD TABLET STAMPED FITIUTA ET 1962 RN GARDNER SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN ROCK.                             STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1962 (RNG) LOCATED ON FITIUTA POINT N OF VILLAGE OF MAIA. ABOUT 1500 FT NW OF SCHOOL IN FITIUTA. STATION IS NEXT TO SOUTHERNMOST BLACK ROCK OF POINT NEAR OCEAN EDGE AND ABOUT 100 FT FROM EDGE OF BUSH.   STATION MARK IS A STANDARD TABLET STAMPED FITIUTA ET 1962 RN GARDNER SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN ROCK.                             STATION RECOVERY (1993)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1993 (JGF) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED. STATION IS NOW ON PROPERTY OWNED BY THE AIRPORT, THE AIRPORT AUTHORITY WILL HAVE TO BE CONTACTED FOR ACCESS TO THE MARK.                            STATION RECOVERY (2017)  RECOVERY NOTE BY WOOLPERT CONSULTANTS 2017 (DMH) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 5.8 MI (9.3 KM) EAST OF FALEASAO AND 5.9 MI (9.5 KM) NORTHEAST OF THE TAU WHARF, ON THE COAST AT THE FITIUTA AIRPORT.  OWNERSHIP--AMERICAN SAMOA DEPARTMENT OF PORT ADMINISTRATION, POST OFFICE.  BOX 1539, PAGO PAGO, AS, 96799, TELEPHONE 684-633-4251.  TO REACH FROM THE INTERSECTION OF THE TAU WHARF ENTRANCE AND THE MAIN ROAD, GO NORTHWESTERLY ON THE MAIN ROAD FOR 0.7 MI (1.1 KM) TO A PAVED ROAD ON THE RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT ONTO THE PAVED ROAD AND TRAVEL SOUTHEAST, NORTH, NORTHEAST AND EAST FOR 6.9 MI (11.1 KM) TO THE ENTRANCE TO THE FITIUTA AIRPORT ON THE LEFT.  TURN LEFT ON THE AIRPORT ENTRANCE ROAD AND GO NORTHEAST, THEN NORTH FOR 450 FT (137.2 M) TO THE TERMINAL PARKING AREA.  PASS THROUGH THE ENTRANCE GATE STRAIGHT AHEAD AND TURN RIGHT, CROSSING THE MAIN APRON TO TAXIWAY A AND A GRASS PERIMETER ROAD ON YOUR LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND DRIVE DOWNHILL NORTHWEST AND NORTHEAST ON THE GRASS ROAD FOR 0.15 MI (0.24 KM) TO A GATE IN THE PERIMETER FENCE.  EXIT THE VEHICLE AND WALK NORTHWEST THROUGH THE GATE THEN NORTHEAST, KEEPING THE PERIMETER FENCE ON YOUR RIGHT HAND SIDE, TO THE END OF THE FENCE AT THE COASTLINE.  TURN RIGHT AND STEPPING OVER THE CONCRETE FOUNDATION OF THE PERIMETER FENCE, WALK ALONG THE COASTLINE FOR 140 FT (42.7 M)  TO A HIGH POINT IN THE LAVA FLOW AND THE STATION ON YOUR RIGHT.  THE STATION IS AN USGS BENCH MARK DISK CEMENTED IN THE LAVA.  IT IS 137.2 FT (41.8 M) EAST-NORTHEAST OF THE END OF THE CONCRETE FOUNDATION OF THE AIRPORT PERIMETER FENCE, 108.7 FT (33.1 M) NORTH OF A 3 FT (0.9 M) TALL WOODEN POST SET IN A ROCK AND CONCRETE FOUNDATION AT THE TOE OF SLOPE OF THE RUNWAY FILL AND 101.9 FT (31.1 M) NORTHEAST OF A 3 FT (0.9 M) TALL WOODEN POST SET IN A ROCK AND CONCRETE FOUNDATION.

THE STATION IS LOCATED ON CAPE FOGAUSA ON THE SOUTHEAST SHORE OF TUTUILA ISLAND ABOUT 1-1/4 AIRLINE MILES SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF FAGAITUA VILLAGE AND ABOUT 3/4 AIRLINE MILES SOUTH OF ALOFAU VILLAGE. REFERENCE MARK NO 2 IS A STANDARD AMERICAN SAMOA REFERENCE DISK STAMPED---FOGAUSA PT USGS 1962 RM 2 1968---, SET IN THE TOP OF A 6-INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 1-INCH. markers.description: DESCRIBED BY AMERICAN SAMOA SURVEY 1961 (CND) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN THE VILLAGE OF LALOPUA AND ON THE SHORELINE OF PAGO PAGO HARBOR. STATION RECOVERY (2002)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 2002 (EEC) TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE VILLAGE OF AFAO, FOLLOW THE MAIN ROAD ALONG THE COAST IN A WNW DIRECTION FOR 1.6 MI (2.6 KM) AND A GRADED TURNOUT ON THE LEFT AT A CONCRETE GUARD RAIL.  THE STATION IS ON THE LEDGE BETWEEN THE ROAD AND THE PINACLE, 9.0 FT (2.7 M) EAST OF THE WEST EDGE OF THE SHELF, AND 6.0 FT (1.8 M) WEST OF THE EAST EDGE OF THE SHELF, AND PROJECTS 3 INCHES.

markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.description: DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1968 (CND) THE STATION IS LOCATED JUST NORTH OF A PASS 1 AIRLINE MILE SOUTHWEST OF PAGO PAGO, ABOUT 1-1/2 AIRLINE MILE WEST OF FAGATOGO AND ABOUT 1/2 AIRLINE MILE EAST OF FAGASA VILLAGE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN FAGATOGA, GO WESTERLY ON THE MAIN ROAD FOR 1.25 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHWEST UPHILL ON A WINDING ROAD FOR 1.45 MILE TO THE TOP OF THE PASS AND A TRACK ROAD RIGHT. TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTHERLY ON THE TRACK ROAD FOR 0.05 MILE TO A SADDLE ON THE RIGHT AND END OF TRUCK TRAVEL.  FROM HERE PACK SOUTHEAST ON A TRAIL FOR ABOUT 50 YARDS TO THE STATION.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD AMERICAN SAMOA TRIANGULATION STATION DISK STAMPED---LEUA 1968---, SET IN THE TOP OF A 6-INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 1-INCH.  IT IS 25 FEET SOUTH OF THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE HILL, 15 FEET EAST OF THE WEST EDGE OF THE HILL AND 10 FEET NORTH OF THE SOUTH EDGE OF THE HILL.  REFERENCE MARK NO 1 IS A STANDARD AMERICAN SAMOA REFERENCE DISK STAMPED---LEUA RM 1 1968---, BRAZED TO THE TOP OF A 2-INCH ROUND IRON PIPE WHICH PROJECTS 4-INCHES.  IT IS ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE HILL AND 8 FEET SOUTH OF THE NORTH EDGE OF THE HILL.  ONLY ONE REFERENCE MARK AT THIS STATION.  TRIANGULATION STATION FAGATELE MAY BE USED AS AN AZIMUTH MARK.  SEE DESCRIPTION THEREOF.                            STATION RECOVERY (UNK )  RECOVERED UNK RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.

markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.description: DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1968 (CND) THE STATION IS ON TUTUILA ISLAND, 1 MILE SOUTHWEST OF FAGAILIILI POINT, 1/2 MILE EAST OF AUMI VILLAGE.  IT IS AT THE SOUTHWEST END OF FAGALTUA BAY ON MATALIGALU POINT.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN FAGATOGO, TAKE THE HIGHWAY AROUND THE NORTH SIDE OF THE HARBOR FOR 7.5 MILES TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT.  THE STATION MARK IS AN AMERICAN SAMOA TRIANGULATION DISK STAMPED---LIGALU 1968---.  IT IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 18-INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 4 INCHES. IT IS 25 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE ROAD AND 8 FEET NORTH OF A POWER POLE WITH A WITNESS SIGN.  RM 1 IS A SLIGHTLY MUTILATED DISK WITH NO LEGIBLE STAMPING.  IT IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 2-INCHES. IT IS 29 FEET EAST OF POWER POLE WITH WITNESS SIGN, 20-1/2 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE ROAD AND 5 FEET NORTH OF BLUFF LEADING TO THE SEA.  RM 2 IS AN AMERICAN SAMOA DISK STAMPED---LIGALU RM 2 1968---.  IT IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 16-INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS ABOUT 1-INCH.  IT IS 27-1/2 FEET WEST OF POWER POLE WITH WITNESS SIGN, 23-1/2 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE ROAD AND 3 FEET NORTH OF A ROCK OUTCROP. STATION IS LOCATED 1.0 MILE (1.6 KM) SOUTHWEST OF FAGAILIILI POINT, 1/2 MILE EAST OF AUMI VILLAGE ON TUTUILA ISLAND IN AMERICAN SAMOA. markers.setting: SET IN ROCK OUTCROP
markers.description: DESCRIBED BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1962 (RNG) STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 7.5 MI (12.1 KM) SW OF PAGO PAGO ON LOGOLOGO POINT, IT IS ABOUT 0.3 MI (0.5 KM) S OF MAIN RD JUNCTION IN VILLAGE OF LEONE.  TO REACH FROM THE POST OFFICE IN FAGATOGA DRIVE 13.4 MI (21.6 KM) W TO LEONE, TURN LEFT AT MAIN JUNCTION AND GO 0.1 MI, (0.2 KM) TURN RIGHT ON DIM TRACK RD AND GO 0.15 MI (0.24 KM) TO END OF RD AT A MISSION HOUSE, FROM HERE PACK S ALONG COAST ABOUT 1100 FT (335.3 M) TO BASE ROCK POINT AND STATION.  STATION MARK, STANDARD USGS BENCH MARK SET IN AN OLD CONCRETE PLUG THAT HAD A STEEL BAR (NOW RUSTED OFF FLUSH WITH ROCK), STAMPED LOGOLOGO ET 1962 RN GARDNER.                            STATION RECOVERY (1968)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1968 (CND) STATION WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  THERE WERE 2 REFERENCE MARKS ESTABLISHED AT THIS TIME.  ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION NOT AVAILABLE, SO A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION IS AS FOLLOWS.  STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 0.5 MILE SOUTH OF LEONE, ON A ROCK BLUFF KNOWN AS LOGOLOGO PT.  TO REACH FROM THE GOVERNMENT DISPENSARY IN LEONE, GO SOUTHEAST ON PAVED ROAD FOR 0.2 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT, SOUTH, ON A GRAVELED ROAD AND GO FOR 0.1 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT, GO SOUTHWEST AND SOUTH ON TRACK ROAD FOR 0.2 MILE TO END OF ROAD AT MISSION HOUSE.  HERE PACK SOUTH ALONG ROCK CLIFF AT WATERS EDGE FOR 15 MINUTES TO LOGOLOGO PT. AND STATION AS DESCRIBED. STATION IS A U.S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY BENCH MARK DISK, CEMENTED FLUSH IN A DRILL HOLE IN ROCK.  IT IS 30 FEET EAST-NORTHEAST OF EXTREME POINT OF CLIFF, 25 FEET WEST OF THE BRUSH LINE, 15 FEET EAST OF WEST EDGE OF ROCK CLIFF.  THE DISK IS STAMPED---LOGOLOGO ET 1962 R.N. GARDNER---. REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS A STANDARD AMERICAN SAMOA REFERENCE MARK DISK, CEMENTED FLUSH IN A DRILL HOLE IN ROCK.  IT IS 60 FEET EAST- NORTHEAST OF EXTREME POINT OF ROCK CLIFF, 25 FEET EAST OF WEST EDGE OF ROCK CLIFF, 5 FEET WEST OF BRUSH LINE.  THE DISK IS STAMPED--- LOGOLOGO ET USGS 1962 RM 1 1968---.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS A STANDARD AMERICAN SAMOA REFERENCE MARK DISK, CEMENTED FLUSH IN A DRILL HOLE IN ROCK.  IT IS 40 FEET NORTHEAST OF EXTREME POINT OF ROCK CLIFF, 8 FEET NORTH OF SOUTH EDGE OF ROCK CLIFF. THE DISK IS STAMPED---LOGOLOGO ET USGS 1962 RM 2 1968---.  THERE WAS NO AZIMUTH MARK SET TO THIS STATION.  LEONE 2 1968 CAN BE USED.  -SEE DESCRIPTION THEREOF.-                            STATION RECOVERY (UNK )  RECOVERED UNK RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.

markers.setting: OBJECT SURROUNDED BY MASS OF CONCRETE
markers.description: DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1968 (CND) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION OF THE STATION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ON TUTUILA ISLAND, ABOUT 2-3/4 AIRLINE MILES EAST-SOUTHEAST OF LEONE VILLAGE, ABOUT 1 AIRLINE MILE WEST OF VAITOGI VILLAGE AND ABOUT 1/2 AIRLINE MILE SOUTH OF ILIILI VILLAGE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE DISPENSARY IN LEONE VILLAGE, GO EAST ON THE MAIN ROAD FOR 2.5 MILES TO A FORK.  KEEP RIGHT AND GO EAST AND SOUTHEAST ON A BLADED ROAD FOR 0.6 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT. TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTH UPHILL ON A BLADED ROAD FOR 0.6 MILE TO THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE HILL AND THE STATION JUST EAST OF A BUILDING.  THE STATION MARK IS A U.S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY STATION DISK STAMPED---LOGOTALA ET 1962 R N GARDNER---, SET IN THE TOP OF A IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE WHICH PROJECTS 6-INCHES.  IT IS 70 FEET EAST OF THE EAST EDGE OF THE BUILDING, 20 FEET EAST OF A WOODEN FENCE AND 4 FEET NORTHEAST OF A SMALL ELECTRIC BOX.  REFERENCE MARK NO 1 IS A STANDARD AMERICAN SAMOA REFERENCE DISK STAMPED---LOGOTALA ET USGS 1962 RM 1 1968---, SET IN THE TOP OF A 6-INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 8-INCHES.  IT IS 72 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE EAST EDGE OF THE BUILDING, 50 FEET SOUTH- SOUTHWEST OF THE ELECTRIC BOX AND 1 FOOT EAST OF THE WOODEN FENCE.  REFERENCE MARK NO 2 IS A STANDARD AMERICAN SAMOA REFERENCE DISK STAMPED---LOGOTALA ET USGS 1962 RM 2 1968---, SET IN THE TOP OF A 6-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 6-INCHES.  IT IS 41 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF THE EAST SIDE OF THE BUILDING, 30 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE ELECTRIC BOX AND 10 FEET WEST OF THE WOODEN FENCE.  TRIANGULATION STATION VAITOGI MAY BE USED AS AN AZIMUTH MARK.  SEE DESCRIPTION THEREOF.                            STATION RECOVERY (UNK )  RECOVERED UNK RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.

DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1968 (CND) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 2-3/4 MILES EAST-SOUTHEAST OF LEONE AND ATOP LOGOTALA HILL.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE GOVERNMENT DISPENSARY IN LEONE, GO EAST FOR 2.5 MILES TO A Y-FORK.  TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND GO EAST AND SOUTHEAST FOR 0.6 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTH FOR 0.6 MILE TO THE TOP OF THE HILL AND THE STATION.  THE BUILDING IS A WOOD AND METAL STRUCTURE, ABOUT 20 FEET SQUARE AND 10 FEET HIGH, PAINTED ALTERNATELY RED AND WHITE AND IT HAS VARIOUS ANTENNAS ON THE ROOF.  POINT INTERSECTED IS THE CENTER OF THE BUILDING.                            STATION RECOVERY (UNK )  RECOVERED UNK RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1968 (CND) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 2-1/4 MILES NORTHWEST OF LEONE, 1-1/2 MILES WEST-NORTHWEST OF AOLOAUFOU AND ON THE SOUTHWEST END AND HIGHEST POINT OF MANUNU RIDGE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE END OF THE ROAD IN AOLOAUFOU, PACK WEST ALONG A TRACK ROAD FOR ABOUT 200 YARDS TO A HOUSE.  PASS ON THE RIGHT, NORTH, SIDE OF THE HOUSE AND FOLLOW A TRAIL WESTERLY FOR ABOUT 300 YARDS TO A FORK.  TAKE THE LEFT FORK AND FOLLOW THE TRAIL WESTERLY FOR ABOUT 2-1/4 MILES TO THE TOP OF MANUNU RIDGE. BEAR LEFT AND GO SOUTHERLY ALONG THE RIDGE FOR ABOUT 1/4 MILE TO THE HIGHEST POINT IN THE IMMEDIATE VICINITY AND THE STATION.  A 1-1/2 HOUR PACK.  THE STATION MARK, STAMPED---MANUNU 1968---, IS A GOVERNMENT OF AMERICAN SAMOA DISK BRAZED TO THE TOP OF A 2-INCH PIPE THAT PROJECTS 4 INCHES.  IT IS 10 FEET WEST OF A TREE STUMP WITH 3 TRUNKS.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1, STAMPED---MANUNU RM 1 1968---, IS A GOVERNMENT OF AMERICAN SAMOA DISK BRAZED TO THE TOP OF A 2-INCH PIPE THAT PROJECTS 8 INCHES. IT IS 23 FEET NORTH OF THE TREE STUMP.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2, STAMPED---MANUNU RM 2 1968---, IS A GOVERNMENT OF AMERICAN SAMOA DISK BRAZED TO THE TOP OF A 2-INCH PIPE THAT PROJECTS 6-INCHES.  IT IS 32 FEET WEST-SOUTHWEST OF THE TREE STUMP.  TRIANGULATION STATION AOLOAU MAY BE USED FOR AN AZIMUTH MARK.  -SEE DESCRIPTION THEREOF.-                            STATION RECOVERY (UNK )  RECOVERED UNK RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.

NOTE, ORIGINAL AND ALL OTHER STATIONS HAVE BEEN DESTROYED BY EXCAVATION OF TOP.  NO PERMANENT MONUMENT WAS SET HERE BECAUSE FAA INTENDS TO EXCAVATE THE ENTIRE TOP OF AIRPORT SIGNALING EQUIPMENT. TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE CHRIST CONGREGATIONAL CHRISTIAN CHURCH IN POLOA, GO NORTH ALONG THE PAVED ROAD FOR 0.1 MILE TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT.  THE STATION MARK IS AN AMERICAN SAMOA STATION DISK STAMPED---POLOA 1968---.  IT IS SET IN THE TOP OF A MASS OF CONCRETE WHICH PROJECTS ABOUT 2 INCHES.  IT IS 36-1/2 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE ROAD, 30.0 FEET SOUTH OF A POWER POLE AND ABOUT 40 FEET WEST OF THE OCEAN.  IT IS ON A LOW BLUFF AND ON THE OUTSIDE EDGE OF A SHARP CURVE IN THE ROAD.  REFERENCE MARK 1, IS AN AMERICAN SAMOA DISK STAMPED---POLOA RM 1 1968---.  IT IS SET IN THE TOP OF 24 INCH MASS OF CONCRETE WHICH PROJECTS ABOUT 3 INCHES. IT IS 31.8 FEET WEST OF A POWER POLE, 22 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF THE ROAD AND 3 FEET NORTH OF THE NORTH EDGE OF THE PAVEMENT. REFERENCE MARK 2 IS AN AMERICAN SAMOA DISK STAMPED---POLOA RM 2 1968---.  IT IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 18-INCH MASS OF CONCRETE WHICH PROJECTS ABOUT 2 INCHES.  IT IS 68 FEET SOUTH OF A POWER POLE, 18 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE ROAD, 8 FEET NORTH OF THE CUT BANK AND 3 FEET SOUTH OF THE SOUTH EDGE OF THE PAVED ROAD.                            STATION RECOVERY (UNK )  RECOVERED UNK RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.

markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.description: DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1968 (CND) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 1/2-MILE SOUTHWEST OF FAGAITUA AND IN A SANDY AREA IN FRONT OF A GROUP OF HOUSES.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE EASTERN HIGH SCHOOL IN FAGAITUA, GO SOUTHWEST FOR 0.35 MILE TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT.  THE STATION MARK, STAMPED---PONALOGO 1968---, IS A GOVERNMENT OF AMERICAN SAMOA DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A CYLINDRICAL, CONCRETE POST THAT IS 6 INCHES IN DIAMETER AND PROJECTS 4 INCHES.  IT IS 65 FEET SOUTH OF THE WEST END OF A FALE, 26 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTER OF THE ROAD AND 11 FEET WEST OF THE CENTER OF A DRIVEWAY.  THE TOP OF THE POST IS SURROUNDED WITH A ROUND MASS OF CONCRETE THAT IS ABOUT 1 FOOT IN DIAMETER.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1, STAMPED---PONALOGO RM 1 1968---, IS A GOVERNMENT OF AMERICAN SAMOA DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A CYLINDRICAL, CONCRETE POST THAT IS 6 INCHES IN DIAMETER AND PROJECTS 2 INCHES.  THE TOP OF THE POST IS SURROUNDED WITH A ROUND MASS OF CONCRETE THAT IS ABOUT 2 FEET IN DIAMETER.  IT IS 14 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTER OF THE ROAD.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2, STAMPED---PONALOGO RM 2 1968---, IS A GOVERNMENT OF AMERICAN SAMOA DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A CYLINDRICAL, CONCRETE POST THAT IS 6 INCHES IN DIAMETER AND PROJECTS 2 INCHES.  THE TOP OF THE POST IS SURROUNDED WITH A ROUND MASS OF CONCRETE THAT IS ABOUT 2 FEET IN DIAMETER.  IT IS 13 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTER OF THE ROAD.  TRIANGULATION STATION PAGAI MAY BE USED FOR AN AZIMUTH MARK.  -SEE DESCRIPTION THEREOF.-                            STATION RECOVERY (2002)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 2002 (EEC) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (UNK )  RECOVERED UNK RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.

markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.description: DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1993 (JGF) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN PAGO PAGO, AMERICAN SAMOA, AT THE INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT. THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 700 FT (213.4 M) SE OF THE TERMINAL BUILDING, ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE NORTH-SOUTH TAXIWAY, IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE BASE OF THE 11TH TAXIWAY LIGHT N OF THE INTERSECTION WITH THE RUNWAY. THE STATION IS A STANDARD TOPO DISK STAMPED -ARP 1964-.                            STATION RECOVERY (1995)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1995 THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 700 FT (213.4 M) SOUTH-EAST OF THE TERMINAL BUILDING, ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE NORTH-SOUTH TAXIWAY, AND IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE 11TH TAXIWAY LIGHT NORTH OF THE INTERSECTION WITH THE RUNWAY.  A STANDARD TOPO DISC SET IN THE DRILL HOLE IN THE LIGHT BASE.  DISC IS STAMPED ARP 1964.  POINT OBSERVED ON DISK IS MARKED WITH A STAMPED LETTER X.                            STATION RECOVERY (2002)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 2002 (EEC) MARK WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (2017)  RECOVERY NOTE BY WOOLPERT CONSULTANTS 2017 (DMH) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN PAGO PAGO, ABOUT 3.7 MI (6.0 KM) SOUTHWEST OF UTULEI, 3.0 MI (4.8 KM) SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF FAGASA AND 1.1 MI (1.8 KM) SOUTHEAST OF NU'UULI I, AT TAFUNA/PAGO PAGO INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT. OWNERSHIP--GOVERNMENT OF AMERICAN SAMOA, DEPARTMENT OF PORT ADMINISTRATION, BOX 1539, PAGO PAGO, AMERICAN SAMOA, 96799.  CONTACT PORT DIRECTOR DR. CLAIRE POUMELE AT 684-733-3076 TO ARRANGE ACCESS.  TO REACH FROM THE INTERSECTION OF ROUTE 1 AND ROUTE 14 IN THE VILLAGE OF NU'UULI, DRIVE SOUTHEAST ON ROUTE 14 FOR 1.05 MI (1.69 KM), PASSING THROUGH FOUR ROUND-ABOUTS TO A BEND IN THE ROAD RIGHT AND A FORK TO THE LEFT.  TAKE THE LEFT FORK AND PROCEED EAST 0.15 MI (0.24 KM) ALONG AN UNNAMED AIRPORT ROAD TO AIRPORT GATE 1 AND A GUARD SHACK ON THE LEFT.  WITH PERMISSION, PASS THROUGH THE GATE AND FOLLOW THE ACCESS ROAD EAST THEN NORTHEAST, PASSING THE NORTH SIDE OF THE TERMINAL BUILDING, FOR 300 FT (91.4 M) TO THE MAIN APRON.  CONTINUE DRIVING NORTHEAST FOR 0.1 MI (0.2 KM) TO THE EASTERN EDGE OF THE APRON.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHEAST FOR 0.15 MI (0.24 KM) TO TAXIWAY C.  CONTINUE SOUTHEAST ON TAXIWAY C FOR 220 FT (67.1 M) TO THE THIRD TAXIWAY EDGE LIGHT AND THE STATION ON YOUR LEFT.  THE STATION IS A A USCGS TOPOGRAPHIC STATION DISC SET IN CONCRETE 0.15 FT (5 CM) BELOW GRADE, ACCESS TO THE MARK IS THROUGH A 4 INCH (10 CM) DIAMETER PCV PIPE WITH CAP SET IN THE SOUTHERN CORNER OF THE CONCRETE FOUNDATION FOR TAXIWAY LIGHT C-24.  THERE IS NO CENTER PUNCH ON THE DISC.  THE POINT OBSERVED WAS THE STAMPED LETTER X AS DESCRIBED IN 1995.  IT IS 242.4 FT (73.9 M) EAST OF THE C/A TAXIWAY DIRECTION SIGN AT THE APRON, 159.1 FT (48.5 M) SOUTHEAST OF THE CENTER OF A 2 FT (0.6 M) ELECTRIC VAULT LID ON THE EAST SIDE OF TAXIWAY C, 43.5 FT (13.3 M) SOUTHWEST OF THE EDGE OF TAXIWAY C, 43.4 FT (13.2 M) NORTHEAST OF THE CENTERLINE OF TAXIWAY C.

markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.description: DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1993 (JGF) THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE S SIDE NEAR THE MIDDLE OF TUTUILA ISLAND ON THE S SIDE OF THE PAGO PAGO INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT, ALONG THE SHORE IN A LAVA FLOW ABOUT 115 M (377.3 FT) W OF THE JUNCTION OF TAXIWAY A AND RUNWAY 5-23. THE STATION IS A NOS BRASS DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN EXPOSED BLACK LAVA.  IT IS 350 FT (106.7 M) SW OF THE EXTENDED CENTERLINE OF TAXIWAY A AT ITS POINT OF INTERSECTION WITH THE MAIN E-W RUNWAY, 23 M (75.5 FT) SSE OF THE S EDGE OF THE MACADAM SHOULDER OF THE RUNWAY, 150 M (492.1 FT) SE OF THE GLIDE SLOPE ANTENNA, AND 13 M (42.7 FT) NW OF A PROMINENT BLOWHOLE.  THE BLOWHOLE HAS BEEN PARTIALLY COVERED WITH SLABS OF CONCRETE TO REDUCE SPRAY OVER THE RUNWAY.                            STATION RECOVERY (1995)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1995 THE STATION IS LOCATED IN THE SOUTHWEST PART OF THE AIRPORT IN A LAVA FLOW 1560 FT (475.5 M) NE OF RWY END 5.  IT IS 794 FT (242.0 M) NE OF THE GLIDE SLOPE ANTENNA AND 350 FT (106.7 M) SW OF THE CL INTERSECTION OF RWY 5-23 AND TAXIWAY A.  IT IS 199.7 FT (60.9 M) SE OF THE RUNWAY CENTERLINE AND 125.1 FT (38.1 M) SE OF THE 8TH RUNWAY LIGHT NE RWY END 5.  THE STATION IS AN NOS DISK STAMPED PPG B 1993 SET IN A DRILLHOLE IN EXPOSED BLACK LAVA ABOUT GROUND LEVEL.  IT IS 43 FT (13.1 M) NW OF A PROMINENT BLOWHOLE WHICH HAS BEEN PARTIALLY COVERED WITH SLABS OF CONCRETE.                            STATION RECOVERY (2002)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 2002 (EEC) THE STATION IS LOCATED ON PAGO PAGO INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT.  THE STATION IS RECOVERED BUT NOW HAS 8 OR 10 INCH PIPE AROUND THE MARK.                            STATION RECOVERY (2017)  RECOVERY NOTE BY WOOLPERT CONSULTANTS 2017 (DMH) THE STATION IS LOCATED NEAR THE SOUTH COAST OF THE ISLAND OF TUTUILA, ON THE GROUNDS OF THE PAGO PAGO INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT.  TO REACH FROM THE INTERSECTION OF ROUTE 1 AND ROUTE 14 IN THE VILLAGE OF NU'UULI, DRIVE SOUTHEAST ON ROUTE 14 FOR 1.05 MI (1.69 KM), THROUGH FOUR ROUND-ABOUTS TO A BEND IN THE ROAD RIGHT AND A FORK TO THE LEFT. TAKE THE LEFT FORK AND PROCEED EAST 0.15 MI (0.24 KM) ALONG AN UNNAMED AIRPORT ROAD TO PAGO PAGO INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT GATE 1 AND A GUARD SHACK ON THE LEFT. WITH PERMISSION PASS THROUGH THE GATE AND FOLLOW THE ACCESS ROAD EAST THEN NORTHEAST, PAST THE NORTH SIDE OF THE TERMINAL BUILDING, FOR 300 FT (91.4 M) TO THE MAIN APRON.  CONTINUE DRIVING NORTHEAST FOR 0.1 MI (0.2 KM) TO THE EASTERN EDGE OF THE APRON.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHEAST FOR 0.15 MI (0.24 KM) TO TXY C. CONTINUE SOUTHEAST ALONG TXY C TOWARDS THE VORTAC, CROSSING RUNWAY 05-23 AND ONTO AN ACCESS ROAD FOR 0.25 MI (0.40 KM) TO A FOUR WAY INTERSECTION.  TURN RIGHT ON THE AIRPORT PERIMETER ROAD AND GO 0.75 MI (1.21 KM) TO A JOG IN THE PERIMETER FENCE AND THE STATION ON YOUR RIGHT.  THE PIPE AROUND THE MARK DESCRIBED IN 2002 NO LONGER EXISTS.  THE BLOWHOLE DESCRIBED IN 1995 STILL EXISTS AND IS A CONCERN FOR USERS. THE MONUMENT IS FREQUENTLY SPRAYED BY SALT WATER AND OFTEN SUBMERGED 0.5 FT (15 CM) OR MORE.  THE MARK IS 357 FT (108.8 M) SOUTHWEST FROM THE EXTENDED CENTERLINE OF TXY B, 199.6 FT (60.8 M) SOUTHEAST FROM THE CENTERLINE OF RWY 05, 81.1 FT (24.7 M) SOUTHWEST FROM AN ANGLE POINT IN THE PERIMETER FENCE, 23.3 FT (7.1 M) NORTHWEST OF THE PERIMETER FENCE AND 3.50 FT (1.1 M) NORTHWEST OF THE EDGE OF THE PERIMETER ROAD.

IT IS 223.75 FT (68.2 M) FROM THE END OF THE AIRPORT PERIMETER ROAD AT THE AIRCRAFT RESCUE AND FIRE FIGHTING (ARFF) STATION APRON, 207.6 FT (63.3 M) NORTH-NORTHEAST OF TAXIWAY LIGHT A-14, 80.7 FT (24.6 M) WEST-NORTHWEST OF TAXIWAY LIGHT A-13 AND 56.35 FT (17.2 M) NORTHWEST OF THE EDGE OF PAVEMENT OF TAXIWAY A.  THIS MARKS IS DESIGNATED AS A SECONDARY AIRPORT CONTROL STATION.

markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.description: DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1968 (CND) THE STATION IS ON TUTUILA ISLAND, 2.2 MILES NORTH-NORTHWEST OF STEPS POINT, 1.3 MILES NORTH-NORTHEAST OF PUPUALOA POINT AND 1.1 MILES EAST OF LEONA.  THE STATION MARK IS AN AMERICAN SAMOA TRIANGULATION STATION DISK STAMPED---PUAPUA 1968---.  IT IS SET IN TOP OF A 18 INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS ABOUT 1 INCH.  IT IS 54-1/2 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE ENTRANCE OF A SMALL STORE, 14-1/2 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE MAIN PAVED ROAD AND 13 FEET EAST OF A WITNESS SIGN ON A PALM TREE.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS AN AMERICAN SAMOA DISK STAMPED---PUAPUA RM 1 1968---.  IT IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 18-INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 4 INCHES.  IT IS 71-1/2 FEET EAST OF A TREE WITH A WITNESS SIGN, 35 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE ROAD AND 34 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A SMALL STORE.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS AN IRON ROD WHICH IS NOT STAMPED.  IT IS DRIVEN FLUSH INTO THE CENTER LINE OF THE ROAD.  IT IS 71-1/2 FEET WEST OF THE DOOR OF THE STORE AND 65 FEET NORTH OF THE TREE WITH THE WITNESS SIGN.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE LEONE DISPENSARY, GO EAST ALONG THE MAIN HIGHWAY FOR 1.3 MILES TO STATION ON THE RIGHT.                            STATION RECOVERY (2002)  RECOVERY NOTE BY AMERICAN SAMOA POWER AUTHORITY 2002 (FW) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN LEPUAPUA, ABOUT 11.5 MILES (18.5 KM) FROM THE FAGASA AND PAGO PAGO INTERSECTION, JUST BEFORE THE FAASAO-MARIST HIGH SCHOOL.  OWNERSHIP AMERICAN SAMOA GOVERNMENT.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF FAGASA AND PAGO PAGO, GO WEST ON HWY 001 FOR ABOUT 11.5 MILES (18.5 KM) TO LEPUAPUA, JUST BEFORE THE FAASAO-MARIST HIGH SCHOOL ON THE LEFT SIDE OF THE ROAD NEXT TO A FIRE HYDRANT,  DISK SET IN TOP OF A 18 INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT, 25.50 FEET (7.77 M) EAST OF 1990 FIRE HYDRANT NO 37G3, 89.09 FEET (27.15 M) NORTHWEST OF POWER POLE NO 50AH39, 60.17 FEET (18.34 M) EAST OF POWER POLE NO 50AH33 AND 81.57 FEET (24.86 M) SOUTH OF POWER POLE IN PRIVATE RESIDENCE.  NOTE--AS 50 2002 WAS STAMPED FOR THIS SURVEY IN 2002.                            STATION RECOVERY (UNK )  RECOVERED UNK RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.

THE STATION MARK, STAMPED---PULE GAS 1966---, IS A U.S. CORPS OF ENGINEERS DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A CYLINDRICAL, CONCRETE POST THAT IS 6-INCHES IN DIAMETER AND 6 INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND. IT IS 17 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE SOUTHEAST BANK OF A SMALL CANAL, 16 FEET WEST OF AN ANTENNA POLE AND 8 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE SHORELINE.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1, STAMPED---PULE GAS 1966 RM 1 1968---, IS A GOVERNMENT OF AMERICAN SAMOA DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A CYLINDRICAL, CONCRETE POST THAT IS 6 INCHES IN DIAMETER AND PROJECTS 8 INCHES. IT IS 34 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE SOUTHEAST BANK OF THE CANAL, 11 FEET EAST OF THE ANTENNA POLE AND 3 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE SHORELINE.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2, STAMPED---PULE GAS 1966 RM 2 1968---, IS A GOVERNMENT OF AMERICAN SAMOA DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A CYLINDRICAL, CONCRETE POST THAT IS 6 INCHES IN DIAMETER AND PROJECTS 4 INCHES. markers.setting: SET IN ROCK OUTCROP
markers.description: DESCRIBED BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1993 (JGF) THE STATION IS ON THE S END OF ROSE ISLAND, ROSE ATOLL, APPROXIMATELY 160 MI (257.5 KM) E OF PAGO PAGO, AMERICAN SAMOA. ROSE ATOLL IS A NATIONAL WILDLIFE REFUGE THAT CAN ONLY BE REACHED WITH A VERY GOOD BOAT. AN ESCORT BY THE U. S. FISH AND WILDLIFE SERVICE MUST BE PRESENT WHILE ON THE ISLAND.  THE STATION IS SET ON A CORAL ROCK LEDGE THAT IS ABOUT 8 FT (2.4 M) ABOVE THE PRESENT LOW WATER MARK.  THIS LEDGE IS THE ONLY ROCK ON THE ISLAND THAT CONSISTANTLY STAYS ABOVE HIGH WATER. THE STATION IS 10 FT (3.0 M) INSHORE FROM THE VEGETATION GROWS QUICKLY SO THE STATION WILL PROBABLY BE COVERED SOON. THE STATION IS A STANDARD NOS DISK STAMPED -ROSE 1993- AND CEMENTED INTO A DRILL HOLE IN A CORAL ROCK OUTCROP.

markers.setting: OBJECT SURROUNDED BY MASS OF CONCRETE
markers.description: DESCRIBED BY US ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEERS 2011 (UNK) MARK IS LOCATED ON ISLAND OF AUNUU SMALL BOAT HARBOR IN AMERICAN SAMOA.   TO REACH THE MARK YOU NEED TO TAKE A SMALL BOAT FROM AUASI HARBOR ON THE ISLAND OF TUTUILA TO AUNUU SMALL BOAT HARBOR.   THE IS LOCATED ON THE JETTY TO RIGHT AS YOU ARE LEAVING THE AUNUU HARBOR ABOUT ONE FEET FROM THE PANIC AREA.  THE MARK IS SET IN A MASS OF CONCRETE WITH LP FRENCH SURVEY DISK.                            STATION RECOVERY (2014)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEERS 2014 (SRF) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.

markers.description: DESCRIBED BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1968 (CND) THE STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION. IT IS 316 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE NORTHWEST EDGE OF THE RUNWAY, 103 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE SOUTHWEST EDGE OF THE RUNWAY AND 74 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE SOUTHEAST EDGE OF THE RUNWAY. markers.setting: SET IN ROCK OUTCROP
markers.description: DESCRIBED BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1962 (RNG) STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 7 MI (11.3 KM) SW OF PAGO PAGO ON SAIL ROCK POINT.  THERE IS A LONE ROCK SPIRE JUST OFF SHORE OF THIS POINT. STATION IS ABOUT 1 MI (1.6 KM) SW FROM THE CENTER OF THE VILLAGE OF VAITOGI.  TO REACH FROM THE POST OFFICE IN FAGATOGO DRIVE W ON RD TO LEONE FOR 11.1 MI., TURN SHARPLY LEFT AND GO 0.4 MI., TAKE RIGHT FORK AND GO 1.6 MI (2.6 KM) PASSING THRU THE VILLAGE OF VAITOGA TO SHORE AND END OF TRUCK TRAVEL.  FROM HERE PACK SW ALONG SHORE ABOUT 0.25 MI (0.40 KM) TO PINT AND STATION.  STATION MARK, STANDARD BENCH MARK TABLET SET IN THE SOLID BARE ROCK OF THE POINT, ABOUT 66 FT (20.1 M) ABOVE THE OCEAN AND STAMPED SAIL ROCK ET 1962 RN GARDNER                            STATION RECOVERY (1968)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1968 (CND) THE STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  TWO NEW REFERENCE MARKS WERE ESTABLISHED AT THE STATION.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION OF THE STATION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ON TUTUILA ISLAND ABOUT 1-1/2 AIRLINE MILES SOUTHEAST OF FUTIGA VILLAGE, ABOUT 3/4 AIRLINE MILES SOUTHWEST OF VAITOGI VILLAGE AND ABOUT 150 FEET NORTHWEST OF A LARGE OUTCROPPING ROCK WHICH IS ABOUT 100 FEET OFF SHORE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE CHURCH IN VAITOGI VILLAGE, GO SOUTH ON A BLADED ROAD FOR 0.15 MILE TO A FORK. STATION RECOVERY (1968)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1968 (CND) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  TWO REFERENCE MARKS WERE ESTABLISHED.  A COMPLETE DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS--  THE STATION IS LOCATED 1/2 MILE SOUTHWEST OF POLOA, 1/2 MILE EAST OF TAPUTAPU ISLAND AND ATOP A LOW HILL. BEAR RIGHT AND FOLLOW THE RIDGE AND AN OLD ROAD, WESTERLY, FOR ABOUT 1/4 MILE TO THE HIGHEST POINT IN THE IMMEDIATE VICINITY AND THE STATION.  A 20 MINUTE PACK.  THE STATION MARK, STAMPED---TAPUTAPU ET 1962 R.N. GARDNER---, IS A U.S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH SQUARE, CONCRETE POST THAT PROJECTS 8 INCHES. REFERENCE MARK NO. 2, STAMPED---TAPUTAPU USGS 1962 RM 2 1968---, IS A GOVERNMENT OF AMERICAN SAMOA DISK BRAZED TO THE TOP OF A 3-INCH STEEL PIPE THAT PROJECTS 1 FOOT. TURN RIGHT AND DRIVING OFF-ROAD GO SOUTHEAST FOR 300 FT (91.4 M), CROSSING THE ARFF DRIVEWAY APRON, TO A DIRT ROAD AND THE AIRPORT PERIMETER FENCE ON YOUR RIGHT.  CONTINUE SOUTHEAST ALONG THE AIRPORT PERIMETER ROAD FOR 0.4 MI (0.6 KM) TO A GATE IN THE AIRPORT PERIMETER FENCE.  OPEN THE PERIMETER FENCE GATE AND PROCEED ON FOOT, SOUTHEAST, THEN NORTHEAST, THEN NORTHWEST, THEN NORTH, KEEPING THE PERIMETER FENCE ON YOUR LEFT, FOR 0.20 MI (0.32 KM) TO THE COASTLINE AND THE END OF THE PERIMETER FENCE ON YOUR LEFT.  TURN RIGHT AND WALK SOUTHEAST, FOLLOWING THE COAST LINE, 200 FT (61.0 M) TO THE STATION SET IN THE LAVA ON YOUR RIGHT.  IT IS 247.7 FT (75.5 M) NORTHEAST OF AN ANGLE POINT IN THE PERIMETER FENCE, 154.2 FT (47.0 M) EAST OF AND PERPENDICULAR TO THE NORTH-SOUTH PERIMETER FENCE, 150.5 FT (45.9 M) SOUTHEAST OF THE NORTH END OF THE PERIMETER FENCE FOUNDATION, 130 FT (39.6 M) NORTH OF AN ANGLE POINT IN THE PERIMETER FENCE.
